list_definition.definition: a type of serious infectious disease in which there is a severe rash of large, pus-filled spots that usually leave scars

list_ex_of_english: Outbreaks of smallpox neither confined themselves to certain years nor did they have a uniform impact on the country.

In this latter sense, smallpox can perhaps be used as a proxy for overcrowding and disamenity.
